intro: Minuartia pusilla var. diffusa, commonly known as the dwarf rockcress, is a low-growing flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It is often found in mountainous areas and tundra environments. Due to its small size and specialized habitat, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local insect populations.
